passages.text:
(set: $inv to (a: "keycard"))
(set: $keycardState to "broken")
(set: $availRooms to (a: "EXT. Apartment B82-77"))
Post Climate City. Lower Classes relegated to below sea level, while upper classes are privileged with exposure to sunlight. Uniform architecture, sturdy but narrow pyramids.



<img src="https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/818234840214274101/821490463042568212/unknown.png">
(link: "About the world")[Our story takes place in The Eastern Statenal Collective (E.S.C), a self sustaining megalopolis contained entirely within climate controlled towers. The ESC's Mission Statement (predating it's founding and construction) states that it, as well as it's citizens, are strong in their independence, with an emphasis on "forging their own path" and frequent mobility.

Random stuff:

* It is the norm for people to constantly be moving from floor to floor, each floor has something slightly unique to shake things up, and the core motivation for citizens is to reach the secure and luxurious upper echelons of their society (a pipe dream).
* Identity can be changed at will by it's citizens, anonymity is a right
* Following the fracturing of the internet, the ESC has it's own unique network: NetESC. All members are anonymous with no way of seeing a throughline between posts (though job titles are shown when verification is necessary)
* Traditional social websites have been replaced with direct communication between members.]
---
[[Start->Your Apartment]]

passages.name: Hub Area

passages.text:
Apartment B82-73. Where missing person's friend is.

(if: $door73 is "unlocked")[[[Knock on door. ->INT. Apartment B82-73]]]
passages.name: EXT. Apartment B82-73

passages.text:
(link: "Look around")[A standard newstand, at first glance. It's magazines, however are just projected images from a screen.]
(link: "Talk to attendant")[
	(set: $inv to it + (a: "mpGame"))
WIP. You takl about missing person The attendant lets you in on his (predictable) conspiracy theory. Big bad took person for some reason might have had something to do with this:

The man at the newstand gives you a datastick labelled "s.c.-v1.6"

It's a somewhat broken version of an old multiplayer game that belonged to missingperson (massive multiplayer games were regulated for their violation of the anonymity clause as well as addictive/escapist tendencies). I'ts only playable with bots but says m.p. made some mods to it

Hint: show game to clara.].
passages.name: The Newstand

passages.text:
Security Station. WIP basically character front for the "corporation".

(link: "DEV: Location Breakdown")[First reason for coming here is getting access to room 77.]

(if: $keycardState is "broken")[(link: "Ask for access to Apt 77.")[(show: ?fix-keycard)]]
|fix-keycard)[Dialogue WIP. Security personell gives you access and reinforces that all property is property of the corporation.
(link:"Okay.")[(set: $keycardState to "fixed")]]
(if: $keycardState is "fixed")[[[Go to hub. ->Hub Area]]]
passages.name: Security Station

passages.text:
(if: $door77 is "unlocked")[(show:?enterRoom)]
Apartment B82-77, between B82-76 and B82-78.

There's someone by the door.

{(link: "Talk to them.")[
	(set: $door73 to "unlocked")
	(set: $availRooms to it + (a:"EXT. Apartment B82-73"))
Dialogue TK. Citizen's friend, Clara. She's hiding something. Tells you that he didn't move and didn't die. Knows that you have to recycle everything, but hopes maybe she can keep something of whatever you find in there? You  can talk to her in [[Apt B82-73 ->EXT. Apartment B82-73]]]}
{(link: "Use keycard")[
	(if: $keycardState is "broken")[(show:?locked)]
	(else-if: $keycardState is "fixed")[(show:?unlocked)]
	]}
{|locked)[
	(set: $availRooms to it + (a:"Security Station"))
You bring your keycard to the door but it doesn't open. //You probably need to get access at security//.]}
{|unlocked)[
	(set: $door77 to "unlocked")(show:?enterRoom)
The door lock chimes. ]}

|enterRoom)[[[Enter Room. ->INT. Apartment B82-77]]]
passages.name: EXT. Apartment B82-77

passages.text:
WIP. Dialog with misingperson/final scene. Explains how to fully become one with the machine and enter a new natural utopia. Probably have questioning dialog options on how you're just running away from reality. Utopia is the shorter ending whereas go home might have a bit more of a falling action talking to Clara and such.

[[Utopia]]
[[Go Home]]
passages.name: Inside the Network

passages.text:
"Look, it's important to comment even the simplest code...|more)[ You might remember what it does now, but not at 4:50 PM on Friday afternoon, when you're about to push to production and a runtime error shows up in it.]"

You (link-reveal:"struggle to listen.")[(show: ?more)]

passages.name: Footer

passages.text:
(link:"Look around")[The room layout is the same as yours of course, but almost completely barren. You wonder if there was some mistake and another repoman had already cleaned out the space.]

(link:"A note")[A cryptic note from missingPerson WIP. Has to indicate that he is in danger but also allude to a breakthrough.]

(if: $inv contains "mpGame")[(link: "Run Game")[(show:?runGame)]]

|runGame)[Placeholder: Gamey elements with hacking into the game? Could be partially corrupted as well, minigame of uncorrupting the floppy.

(link: "on minigame solve")[(show:?ghostMachine)]
]

|ghostMachine)[
Establishing secure connection....

Connected to 100.55.800

WIP: Dialog with "ghost in machine". It explains that the only way to understand is to show you. You neet to get a SEC-VIS from security.

Note from Nic: Open to suggestions on this bit, basically looking for a reason to go back to security and do another thing there before leaving it for good, anyway:

(link: "on sec visited")[(show:?enterTheMatrix)]]

|enterTheMatrix)[ [[Put on the SEC-VIS ->Inside the Network]]]
passages.name: INT. Apartment B82-77

passages.text:
Clara lets you in.

{(link: "Talk to Clara")[
	(set: $availRooms to it + (a:"The Newstand"))
WIP, bigger dialogue tree TK. Key points: even though everyone keeps moving around to different levels in the ESC there are ways to game the system to stay in the same place. MissingPerson, as a human-network engineer showed her how. He also was an avid collector of old-world media, the person at the news stand should have some still.]}

(if: $inv contains "mpGame")[ (link: "Show the game to clara")[(show:?showGame)]]

|showGame)[Dialogue WIP. Says she knows about this, m.p. had gotten really addicted to it recently. Kept saying there was more to it than just a crude empty world ful of ghosts.

Hint: try running the game. In [[Apt 77 ->EXT. Apartment B82-77]]]
passages.name: INT. Apartment B82-73
